title: Whales & Dolphins
description: Dive into the fascinating world of cetaceans, from the mighty blue whale to the playful bottlenose dolphin.

questions.question: The blue whale is the largest animal ever to have lived. How long can it grow?
Dolphins navigate and find prey using what sensory system?
Which whale is known for its complex and beautiful songs that can last for hours?
Baleen whales filter food through plates made of what material?
The sperm whale was famously depicted in which classic novel?
options: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.question: Which is the only species of dolphin that lives exclusively in freshwater rivers?
How do whales and dolphins breathe?
options: They surface to breathe through their mouth
Through a blowhole on top of their head

questions.question: The orca, or killer whale, is actually the largest member of what family?
What is the term for when whales leap out of the water and crash back down?
How long can a sperm whale hold its breath during a deep dive?
The bottlenose dolphin is known for its intelligence. What is one sign of this?
options: It can recognize itself in a mirror

questions.question: Which whale has the longest migration of any mammal?
What is the main food source for the enormous blue whale?
A group of dolphins is commonly called what?
